snippet.title: Arson attack on Perth heritage building
snippet.content: Perth detectives are seeking the public's help to solve an arson attack on a heritage-listed commercial property that caused $150,000 worth of damage. The fire began at the Great Eastern Highway property in Redcliffe about 3am on July 21, and police want to speak to the driver of a white utility seen driving nearby at the time. Rewards of up to $50,000 are available for information that leads to the identification and conviction of an arsonist. (C) AAP 2017
